intro: Dactylorhiza majalis subsp. macedonica, commonly known as the Macedonian marsh orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the Balkan Peninsula. It typically grows in wet meadows, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies, preferring moist, acidic soils. The plant has a slender, erect stem with several oval, leathery leaves. Its flowers are pale green to yellowish, with three sepals and three petals, and are arranged in a loose spike. It blooms from late spring to early summer, contributing to the biodiversity of its wetland habitats.
